title: Samlucky O
author: Samlucky O
content: the rate wey people dey complain about low Bitcoin adoption, I dey think say if Dem introduce Bitcoin as a course of study for our institution, say people go adopt am wella.Wetting dey make Bitcoin adoption dey  slow na because most people no dey educated on Bitcoin. Bitcoin too Dey broad or vast to just be wetting person go learn for street. Just like the way we learn ABCD for school, we supposed to learn Bitcoin from nursery, primary secondary school and tertiary institution. So that we go dey conversant to am. Emagine 30years old Nigeria nan no no wetting Dem dey call Bitcoin.Even if government no gree, we fit dey organise crypto class to enducate the younger generation to avoid always explaining our self. By teaching them everything about crypto currency. Wetting government sabi na to teach us x+y=0 find xy. but no sabi teach the youths how to make money.If the society know the importance of Bitcoin, dem go rush fast. For example if you tell them say with Bitcoin furum their children fit train themselves for school without anybody's help. Dem go dey highly triggered to adopt crypto.Na the small idea  wey I get be that. Wetting ona think about am.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: There is no doubt that integrating blockchain into our education curriculum will help the spread of Bitcoin knowledge vis-a-vis the penetration and adoption of Bitcoin. But I don't see this happening in Nigeria anytime soon. The best that can happen now is to adopt state level approach since each of the states manages their educational boards up to secondary schools. We can raise proposals to our various state governments outlining the need and importance of blockchain technology and Bitcoin. I saw a post where one of our local board member @ibaba sent such proposal to Nasarawa State Governor.  I think such moves can be encouraged across various states of the federation, I am confident one or two of them will surely implement that and others will join when they see the successes.

comments.author: DubemIfedigbo001
comments.body: This your Idea is a good one cos the good news of bitcoin should be spread across a nation as big as ours. The state level implementation is also great, but I don't see it working. Why?, Nigeria operates a federation pattern of leadership and not confederation, power is centered on the federal and it distributes resources, as well as competence to the state level. The adjustment of the academic system of any state and inclusion of any subject is a testimony of the approval of the federal government through its minister of education. The state minister is under the federal minister and doesn't have the veto power to implement a subject as controversial as bitcoin study, knowing fully well the stand of the federal government on it. I don't see it happening soon, but I'm quite optimistic and prayerful cos it will be of great benefit to us all if it finally happens.
